DbExpressionBuilder Class

Definition

Provides an API to construct DbExpressions and allows that API to be accessed as extension methods on the expression type itself.

In this Article

public static class DbExpressionBuilder

outer.Join(inner, o => o.Property("ID"), i => i.Property("ID"), (o, i) => o.Property("Name"))

(TSelector is DbPropertyExpression). 

outer.Join(inner, o => o.Property("ID"), i => i.Property("ID"), (o, i) => new { OName = o.Property("Name"), IName = i.Property("Name") })

If instanceType is a a collection type then every expression in arguments must have a result type that is promotable to the element type of the instanceType. If instanceType is a row type, arguments must contain as many expressions as there are columns in the row type, and the result type of each expression must be equal or promotable to the type of the corresponding column. If instanceType is an entity type, arguments must contain as many expressions as there are properties defined by the type, and the result type of each expression must be equal or promotable to the type of the corresponding property.

source.Select(x => new { Name = x.Property("Name") })

(TProjection is an anonymous type with a DbExpression-derived property).

Creates a new DbApplyExpression that evaluates the given apply expression once for each element of a given input set, producing a collection of rows with corresponding input and apply columns. DbExpression

A DbExpression that specifies the input set.

apply
Func<DbExpression,DbExpression>

A method that represents the logic to evaluate once for each member of the input set.

Func<DbExpression,DbExpression,TSelector>

A method that specifies how an element of the result set should be derived given an element of the input and apply sets. This method must produce an instance of a type that is compatible with SelectMany and can be resolved into a DbExpression. Compatibility requirements for TSelector are described in remarks.

Returns
DbProjectExpression

An new DbProjectExpression that selects the result of the given selector from a new DbApplyExpression with the specified input and apply bindings and an DbExpressionKind of CrossApply.

ArgumentException

The expression produced by apply does not have a collection type. does not have a collection type.

To be compatible with SelectMany, TSelector must be derived from DbExpression, or must be an anonymous type with DbExpression-derived properties. The following are examples of supported types for TSelector: 

source.SelectMany(x => x.Property("RelatedCollection"), (source, apply) => apply.Property("Name"))

(TSelector is an anonymous type with DbExpression-derived properties).
